flashcards.english: Class 4 (Kĩ-/Gĩ- → Ci-/Ĩ-): Gĩkombe gĩkĩ kĩnene (this big cup) → Ĩkombe ĩcĩ nene (these big cups). Diminutive (Ka-/Ga- → tũ-): Gakombe gaka kega (this nice small cup) → tũkombe tũtũ twega (these nice small cups)
flashcards.notes: Class 4: objects, man-made items, sometimes disrespected humans/animals. Diminutive: makes things sound small. Agreement pattern: noun prefix matches demonstrative and adjective. Examples: Kahĩĩ gakĩ gaceke (this slim small boy), Kanyoni gaka gathaka (this beautiful small bird)

examples.kikuyu: Gĩtarũrũ gĩkĩ kĩnene → Ĩtarũrũ ĩcĩ nene
examples.english: This big woven tray → These big woven trays

examples.kikuyu: Gatarũrũ gaka karĩĩ → tũtarũrũ tũtũ twarĩĩ
examples.english: This wide small woven tray → These wide small woven trays

flashcards.english: G: Guka gucia guoko gakwa (Grandfather, pull my hand), Gĩra gĩkombe gĩkĩ (Come for this cup). H: Haha hena heho (This place is cold), Huha mwaki wahota (Blow the fire if you can). K: Kairĩtu kena karamu (The girl has a pen), Kana kona kora kora (The child saw a frog and ran away)
flashcards.notes: Pronunciation practice for velar consonants. Vocabulary: Gĩkombe (cup), Karamu (pen/pencil), Kĩura (frog), Kora (small frog). Shows alliteration for teaching pronunciation

flashcards.english: Na (and/nor), No (but), Kana (or), Thutha wa (after), Ona gũtũĩka (although), Tondũ wa/niamu (because), Kinya rĩrĩa (till)
flashcards.notes: Most conjunctions are phrases, few are single words. Examples: Nĩ marĩaga ngũrũwe na makanyua njohi (They eat pork and drink beer), Nĩ mathakaga no matinaga (They play but they do not dance), No woye karamu kana ibuku (You can take a pen or a book)

examples.english: They neither eat pork nor do they drink beer
examples.notes: Na used for 'nor' in negative context
